medical_history.chief_complaint: 3-day history of wheeze, sore throat, cough, and shortness of breath.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 3 days prior to presentation. The patient reported no fever, tachypnea at 30 breaths per minute, and a peak expiratory flow rate (PEFR) of 120 L per min. Over the next 4 days of treatment, there was little improvement in symptoms and PEFR remained at 150-170 L per min.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Asthma diagnosed in early childhood, eczema, and a history of at least two chest infections per year. Current medications included oral montelukast, inhaled salmeterol and fluticasone twice daily, and inhaled salbutamol as required.
